result.execSummary:
The defendant Araceli Granda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court allows for the transfer of the Probation term to the State of Illinois.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs, DNA surcharge, and the extradition fees of $396.85 that were incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--no possession of a controlled substances without a valid prescription

--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating prescriber

--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 

--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision before leaving the Jefferson Courthouse complex today

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Araceli Granda

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 11:16am. 
Defendant Araceli Granda in court with Attorney Tyler A Jochman.  ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.  
Constitutional rights are reviewed; elements recited; plea of " Guilty " is entered; factual basis stipulated. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Granda on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of a controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by a treating prescriber
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal.  No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without the express written permission of the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision before leaving the Jefferson Courthouse complex today 
--to pay costs, DNA surcharge, and the extradition fees of $396.85 that were incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office 

Days credit for time already served: 5 days

The Court allows for the transfer of the Probation term to the State of Illinois.
The Court denies the Defense request for special disposition of this case. 
The Court requires Ms. Granda to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 3:00pm 
recess 11:37am

Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 11:13 AM 
Defendant Araceli Granda in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Araceli Granda.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.

Ms. Granda waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

recess: 11:20am 

NEXT:   Arraignment & Plea & Sentencing on 10/6/22 at 11:00am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am. {Notice re-mailed to Defendant 7/26/22 to address with corrected Zip code. -AR}

The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Jochman requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing.  
Ms. Granda provides an updated address:  5425 S. Fairfield Avenue Chicago, IL 60632 
recess 2:34pm.

NEXT:  Plea and Sentencing on August 5th at 11:00am with in-person appearances

Current: 5425 S. Fairfield Avenue, Chicago, IL 60632 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 3745 W. Division St., First Floor, Chicago, IL 60651 United States
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 1:58pm 
Defendant Araceli Granda appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD continues to represent Ms. Granda).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments are given on the State's request for cash bond. 
The Court maintains the $2,000 Signature Bond  
recess 2:05pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counse hearing) on July 21st at 2:30pm with Zoom appearances because the Defendant resides in Illinois--JA note in comments that the case is at prelim stage

Co-Defendant Joseph R Tadla does not appear.

ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witnesses are present. 
The Court issues Warrants-Body only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate. 
recess 3:57pm

Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

--maintain absolute sobriety
--not to possess or ingest controlled substances without a valid prescription
--not to discuss the facts of the case with co-defendants

[ma] Case called at 2:35 PM 
Defendant Araceli Granda appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; address of 3745 W. Division St., First Floor, Chicago, 60651

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $2000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not to possess or ingest controlled substances without a valid prescription
--not to discuss the facts of the case with co-defendants
recess 2:40 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 4/21/22 at 3:30pm
